business.headline: Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

ICICI Prudential Asset Management files for IPO. Check offer detailsThe IPO will be an offer for sale of up to 1.77 crore shares, representing 10% of the company's equity share capital. The shares will be sold by Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited (PCHL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based insurer Prudential.
Crizac IPO listing: Shares debut at 14% premium on Dalal StreetCrizac share price: The stock opened at Rs 280 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) showing a 14.29% premium on its Dalal Street debut.

Will Rs 2,000 SIP make you rich? CA breaks it downMany young investors trust SIPs to secure their future but without clear goals, even long-term discipline might not be enough, warns CA and financial planning advisor Abhishek Walia.

Studying abroad? Here's how you can manage your finances smartlyStudying abroad is a huge step, and an amazing opportunity. But a bit of smart financial planning can help you enjoy every moment without money worries.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 158.94 points to 83,553.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.70 points to 25,480.80 as of 9:30 am.

Wolfspeed shares surge 248% in 5 days. What's powering this Nasdaq stock?Wolfspeed shares opened with a 43% jump on Tuesday over the previous day's close of $1.18 and reached an intraday high of $3.33. The stock ended the day at $2.52, up 9%.

Who is Sabih Khan? Apple's new COO overtaking Jeff WilliamsThe announcement came on Tuesday, with the company confirming that Sabih Khan will step into the role later this month. He takes over from Jeff Williams, who has held the post since 2015.

RCB overtakes CSK as IPL's most valuable team, league now worth $18.5 billionA report released by investment bank Houlihan Lokey said the IPL's business value rose by 13% in 2025 to $18.5 billion. At the same time, the brand value of the league increased by 14% to nearly $4 billion.

India, US hopeful of inking trade deal, but New Delhi firm on protecting key sectorsIndia and the United States are nearing a trade deal, with negotiations ongoing. India has taken a firm stance on protecting sensitive sectors, particularly wheat, maize, dairy, and genetically grown crops.

Will central government employees' dearness allowance reach 60%?The government revises the DA/DR rates twice a year, effective from January 1 and July 1. However, the official announcement generally comes a few months later.
Sensex closes 271 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 270 points to end at 83,712.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 61.20 points to close at 25,522.50.

entertainment.headline: Justin Bieber's new album SWAG is clocking in right on time. Here's whyJustin Bieber is making a strong comeback with his new album 'SWAG' set for release on July 11. The album reflects his personal growth, fatherhood, and maturity, featuring collaborations with top artists.

Dekh rahe ho Binod: Priyanka chats with Pradhan, asks for lauki from PhuleraIn a surprise crossover, 'Heads Of State' star Priyanka Chopra shared a fun exchange with Panchayat's Pradhan ji (Raghubir Yadav), a moment that has quickly gone viral.

Nayanthara silences divorce rumours with a cute pic featuring husband Vignesh ShivanNayanthara shared an adorable picture with Vignesh Shivan to address 'loopy' news about them. Recently, reports about them being slapped with a Rs 5 crore notice for their documentary and about their divorce surfaced.

Amitabh Bachchan announces KBC 17 in Agneepath's Vijay style. Watch promoAmitabh Bachchan officially announced the return of Kaun Banega Crorepati. Season 17 in the new promo. The popular quiz show is set to premiere on August 11 on Sony TV.

Priyanka-Nick enjoy dreamy Miami holiday, but Malti's painting steals attentionPriyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas, and daughter Malti Marie have jetted to Miami for their summer break. The actor shared pictures from their trip, and little Malti is too cute to miss.

Kattappa, Baahubali and the pop culture storm Prabhas's iconic film createdSS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' completed a decade on July 10, marking a revolutionary moment for Indian cinema with its unforgettable storytelling and cultural impact. The film, starring Prabhas and Rana Daggubati, not only captivated audiences but also sparked a nationwide meme culture and fan theories, making it a timeless pop culture phenomenon in India.

Not giving up, stand against violence: Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe after firingIn a strong message on Instagram, comedian Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe said that the firing attack late Wednesday night has shocked them, but they won't give up, and will stand firm against violence.

Why the Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot must be more of today, less of 2000The 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot can't survive on nostalgia alone. It must spark real conversations about gender, relationships and inclusivity, turning Tulsi from a tradition-keeper into a cultural voice of change. Here's what we want more of.

Hailee Steinfeld, Miles Teller star in Paramount's Winter Games rom-comParamount's Winter Games stars Hailee Steinfeld and Miles Teller in a rom-com set during the Olympics. The film adds to Steinfeld's busy year, including marriage, a hit thriller, and new music.

Justin Bieber returns with new album Swag after 4-year hiatusJustin Bieber is set to release his new album 'Swag', marking his musical comeback after four years, featuring high-profile collaborations and global teasers that have fuelled fan anticipation.

Kanye West sued by ex-assistant for sexual assault and traffickingLauren Pisciotta has sued Kanye West, accusing him of sexual assault, harassment, and trafficking. She details disturbing incidents, including oral rape and stalking, escalating after she rejected his advances.

Kichcha Sudeep announces K47: I feel the need to bring out a film this yearKannada actor Kichcha Sudeep announced his forty-seventh film, tentatively titled 'K47' with 'Max' director Vijay Kartikeya. During the press conference he revealed that he aims to release the film in December 2025.

When Saif Ali Khan told Sharmila Tagore he doesn't want her, recalls Soha Ali KhanActor Soha Ali Khan recently recalled that as a working mother, Sharmila Tagore didn't see Saif Ali Khan for weeks during his childhood. She mentioned how Saif would get upset with mother Sharmila when she came to meet him.

Here's why Sunny Deol has only 15-minute screen time as Lord Hanuman in RamayanaNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana: Part 1', featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Yash, will release during Diwali 2026. Sunny Deol as Lord Hanuman will have a limited role in the first part with a bigger part in the 2027 sequel, promising a grand spectacle.

The Paradise: Raghav Juyal joins Nani's film, makers share BTS clip on his birthdayOn Raghav Juyal's birthday, the makers of Nani's 'The Paradise' officially welcomed him to the cast with a BTS video. In the clip, director Srikanth Odela teased Juyal's dark and brutal character.

Priyanka Chopra reacts to hot dog vs vada pav backlash: It's not that seriousPriyanka Chopra sparked an online debate after choosing hot dog over vada pav during a rapid-fire food round at her film premiere. Reacting to the backlash, she said, "It's not that serious," reminding fans not to overthink her food choices.

Family refuses to accept Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali's bodyPakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her locked Karachi apartment, with reports suggesting she had died nearly three weeks earlier. Her family's refusal to claim the body has sparked widespread shock and prompted authorities to step in for her final rites.

Exclusive: Madhavan explains why some men are seen as toxic despite good intentionsActor Madhavan opened up about how men are perceived as toxic despite good intentions. In an exclusive conversation with India Today, he highlighted the confusion men face adapting to new ways of respecting women in modern society.

Payal Rohatgi-Sangram Singh shut down divorce rumours with anniversary celebrationAmid divorce rumours, Payal Rohatgi and Sangram Singh clarified that they are still together and celebrated their third wedding anniversary recently. Sangram dismissed the speculation, saying they have been together for 14 years and will always be.

general news.headline: Tennis player's father killed her over taunts of living off her income, says FIRNational tennis player Radhika Yadav was shot dead by her father at their Gurugram home. He confessed to the murder, citing anger over her tennis academy and public remarks.

Not giving up, stand against violence: Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe after firingIn a strong message on Instagram, comedian Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe said that the firing attack late Wednesday night has shocked them, but they won't give up, and will stand firm against violence.

Tej Pratap Yadav to float party? MLA holds rally with new flag after expulsionIn his first rally after parting ways with the RJD, Tej Pratap and his supporters were seen carrying a green-and-white flag, with 'Team Tej Pratap Yadav' written on it.

From Bazball to Blockball: England return to old ways at Lord'sEngland vs India, Lord's Test: England shunned Bazball and turned to Blockball on Day 1 of the Lord's Test. Is this England's way of telling the world that it took them 3 years to get serious about Test cricket?

Fake wedding parties: Kya hai yeh nautanki?Fake weddings are becoming popular in Delhi-NCR as a fresh way to party without nosy relatives. These events combine ethnic fashion, street food and a relaxed atmosphere for urban Indians.

Trump slaps 35% tariff on Canada, plans up to 20% on remaining nationsTrump has already sent letters to 22 countries outlining new tariff rates, including a 50 per cent tariff on imports from Brazil. He warned that any retaliation would be met with even higher tariffs.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

Dekh rahe ho Binod: Priyanka chats with Pradhan, asks for lauki from PhuleraIn a surprise crossover, 'Heads Of State' star Priyanka Chopra shared a fun exchange with Panchayat's Pradhan ji (Raghubir Yadav), a moment that has quickly gone viral.

MG M9 review, first drive: An all-electric alternative to the Toyota Vellfire and Kia Carnival?There's an all-new competitor in the luxury MPV market, a segment which appears to be the next frontier for the ultra-rich. Can the all-electric MG M9 be the choice for the wealthy man in search of a van?

Djokovic vs Sinner: All you need to know about Wimbledon semi-finalWimbledon 2025: 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic and world No. 1 Jannik Sinner will face off in a blockbuster semi-final clash on Friday on Centre Court.

Bodycam video shows moment cop bloodied, sobbing after arrest brawl at US airportFootage from the constable's body-cam was played to the jury which showed a bloodied and crying Ward being comforted by a colleague in the aftermath of the incident.

Bihar voter roll review: Votebandi or necessity? Watch fiery debateThe top focus of this edition of Democratic Newsroom is the ongoing electoral roll revision exercise in Bihar, initiated by the Election Commission ahead of the state assembly election later this year.

The film, starring Prabhas and Rana Daggubati, not only captivated audiences but also sparked a nationwide meme culture and fan theories, making it a timeless pop culture phenomenon in India.

Armed men kidnap, kill nine bus passengers in Pakistan's Balochistan provinceNine bus passengers were kidnapped and shot dead by armed men in Pakistan's Balochistan province, with officials suspecting separatist militants behind the attack. No group has claimed responsibility yet.

No more 'Sir': Bangladesh scraps Hasina-era rule for addressing women officialsBangladesh's interim government has officially cancelled a controversial rule from the Hasina era that required female officials to be addressed as "Sir." A new committee will review titles and suggest gender-appropriate alternatives.

Why the Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot must be more of today, less of 2000The 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot can't survive on nostalgia alone. It must spark real conversations about gender, relationships and inclusivity, turning Tulsi from a tradition-keeper into a cultural voice of change. Here's what we want more of.

'Bathroom camping' is Gen Z's new escape from crisis. Does it help?In the latest episode of what's the new bizarre trend, Gen Z is finding solace in washrooms. Like a quick winding down session, bathrooms are becoming zen rooms. But is it worth it?

Bihar booth officials accept voter forms without documents, using discretionBihar's voter roll revision sees Booth Level Officers submitting forms without documents, relying on personal discretion amid a lack of clarity on Aadhaar norms. The Supreme Court flagged inconsistencies but allowed the process to continue.

As BRICS debates reducing dollar dependence, why India is walking a fine lineNew Delhi's core demand: build alternatives that are interoperable and don't just replace the US dollar with another hegemon

Irresponsible: Centre slams Bhagwant Mann for jibe at PM's foreign visitsWithout naming Bhagwant Mann, the Ministry of External Affairs said that the comments made by a "high state authority" are "irresponsible and regrettable".

The world from Modi's window seat: Tracking PM's flight around the planetThe PM's meetings and events on the ground have been widely covered. But what did his journey look like in the sky? What must Modi have seen from his window?

iPhone 17e, MacBook Pro, more: List of Apple products expected in early 2026Apple is set to launch a wide range of products – including the iPhone 17e, M5 MacBooks, and new iPads – between February and April 2026, according to a Bloomberg report.

Who is Harjeet Singh Laddi, Kalislistani terrorist behind firing at Kap's cafe?Harjeet Singh Laddi, Kalislistani terrorist who claimed responsibility for firing at Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe, has long been under surveillance for his involvement in extremist activities and is on the National Investigation Agency's most-wanted list.

With Cummins lessons, Nitish Reddy hoping to get name on Lord's honour boardNitish Kumar Reddy revealed the lessons he learnt from Pat Cummins about bowling in England and his dream putting his name on the Lord's honours board. Nitish was the pick of the bowlers on Day 1 of the third Test against England.

Recently, reports about them being slapped with a Rs 5 crore notice for their documentary and about their divorce surfaced.

Prabhas, Rana, Rajamouli reunite as Baahubali turns 10. Anushka gives it a missPrabhas, SS Rajamouli, Rana Daggubati and the entire team of 'Baahubali' got together to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the film's release. However, Anushka Shetty, who played Devasena, gave the occasion a miss.

sports.headline: Joe Root has inspired everyone, hope he completes his hundred on Day 2: PopeEngland vice-captain Ollie Pope praised Joe Root for his inspirational presence in the dressing room and expressed hope that the star batter would complete a well-deserved century on Day 2 of the third Test against India at Lord's.

Tottenham Hotspur complete Mohammed Kudus signing from West Ham UnitedTottenham Hotspur have bolstered their squad by signing Mohammed Kudus from West Ham for €55 million, making a bold start to their 2025–26 campaign under new manager Thomas Frank and aiming for silverware on all fronts.

Wiaan Mulder reveals Brian Lara's message: Should've gone for the 400Wiaan Mulder declared on 367 in South Africa's dominant win over Zimbabwe, falling short of Brian Lara's iconic 400. But Lara later told Mulder he should've gone for it and backed him to try again.

How Amanda Anisimova defied mental health battles to rediscover herselfWimbledon: After dropping out of the top 400 of the WTA rankings since her mental health break two years ago, Amanda Anisimova is on the cusp of her maiden Grand Slam and will look for glory when she faces Iga Swiatek in the final.

Ireland's Curtis Campher becomes first man to take five wickets in five ballsIreland all-rounder Curtis Campher etched his name into the history books on Thursday, becoming the first male cricketer in professional cricket to take five wickets in five consecutive deliveries.

Inspired by Shane Warne, Salonee Dangore sets sights on dream WCPL journeyIn an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Chhattisgarh leg-spinner Salonee Dangore spoke about her upcoming stint with the Trinbago Knight Riders and her journey as a net bowler with the Delhi Capitals in the Women's Premier League.

Ben Stokes' injury scare leaves England camp concerned at Lord'sOllie Pope said England are keeping their fingers crossed that captain Ben Stokes has not sustained a serious injury, after he appeared to struggle on the first day of the third Test against India at Lord's.

Mike Hesson clarifies on Babar Azam wicketkeeping suggestion rumoursPakistan's new white-ball coach Mike Hesson said he has had no discussions with Babar Azam about taking up wicketkeeping duties. Babar was recently excluded from the squad for the upcoming T20I series against Bangladesh.

Watch: Jadeja playfully teases Root to take risk for landmark hundredENG vs IND: Ravindra Jadeja playfully teased Joe Root at the fag end of the day's play in the third Test between India and England at the Lord's Cricket Ground.

No Roland Garros repeat, but Aryna Sabalenka reveals Wimbledon hate relationshipAryna Sabalenka said she learned from French Open experience after her rant following the loss in the final to Coco Gauff. Sabalenka admitted that she has a hate relationship with Wimbledon now after losing the semi-final to Amanda Anisimova on Thursday, July 10.

Gavaskar compares unpredictable Rishabh Pant to indomitable Carlos AlcarazSunil Gavaskar drew a notable comparison between cricketer Rishabh Pant and tennis star Carlos Alcaraz. Their shared unpredictability and flair touched a chord with Gavaskar.

Root shines as England trade Bazball's riffs for restraint on Day 1 at Lord'sENG vs IND, 3rd Test: England adopted a cautious batting approach on Day 1 of the third Test against India at Lord's. This shift surprised many as England scored 251 runs at 3.02 runs per over on a tricky pitch.

Iga Swiatek ends agonising wait for final, sets up clash with AnisimovaWimbledon: Iga Swiatek advanced to the final of the grass court major after demolishing Belinda Bencic in straight sets in the semi-final on Thursday on Centre Court.

Boring: Shubman Gill lands brutal dig at England's slowest session in Bazball eraENG vs IND: India captain Shubman Gill openly criticised England's cautious batting on Day 1 of the third Test at Lord's. England scored at less than three runs per over in the second session.

After Virat Kohli's disapproval, Gautam Gambhir reiterates BCCI's family ruleAfter Virat Kohli's take on the BCCI's family rule, Gautam Gambhir supported the new direction put in place for players by the cricket board. BCCI put out the new rule in the aftermath of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy debacle.

Sabalenka's semis jinx continues as Anisimova stuns World No.1Wimbledon 2025: World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka crashed out in the semis as Amanda Anisimova of the United States advanced to the semis after beating her 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 on Centre Court.

I want to see Bazball: Mohammed Siraj sledges cautious Joe Root in Lord's TestMohammed Siraj was back to his chirpy best as he sledged Joe Root during Day one of the Lord's Test on Thursday, July 10. Siraj urged Root to play Bazball during a tight spell right after lunch.

Injury scare for Rishabh Pant at Lord's. Can replacement Dhruv Jurel bat if needed?ENG vs IND: India's Rishabh Pant injured his finger while fielding in the third Test at Lord's. Dhruv Jurel substituted him with the gloves in the second session on Day 1.

Watch: India captain Gill speaks Telugu to praise golden arm man Nitish ReddyIndia captain Shubman Gill praised Nitish Kumar Reddy in Telugu after the Indian all-rounder's fantastic spell during the first session of the Lord's Test. Nitish broke the game open for India with two quick wickets.

Shreyanka Patil returns as India A name squads for Australia tourShreyanka Patil has been picked in the T20 squad as India A named their squads for the multi-format tour of Australia. Radha Yadav will lead the visitors with Minnu Mani as her deputy.

Arsenal complete signing of Brentford captain Christian NorgaardArsenal have completed the signing of Brentford captain Christian Norgaard in a bid to shore up their midfield on Thursday, July 10. Norgaard joins Arsenal after spending six seasons at Brentford.

Captain Shubman Gill shines as Nitish Reddy gamble pays off at Lord'sEngland vs India, Lord's Test: Shubman Gill's decision to bring on part-time pacer Nitish Kumar Reddy paid off on Day 1 at Lord's. England lost two wickets in the same over on Thursday.

Semi-finals Highlights: Swiatek beats Bencic to set up final clash with AnisimovaWimbledon semi-finals Highlights: Iga Swiatek went through to the final after beating Belinda Bencic in straight sets. Earlier in the day, Aryna Sabalenka was stunned by Amanda Anisimova, who beat the World No.1 in straight sets.

Shubman Gill's choices as captain have been measured: Sachin TendulkarENG vs IND: Sachin Tendulkar heaped praise on Shubman Gill for scoring runs in heaps and making measured choices as the captain of the Indian Test team.

Just happens with me man: Rishabh Pant reacts to his flying bat anticsRishabh Pant commented on his flying bat antics as the Indian vice-captain lost grip of his willow twice during the Edgbaston Test. Pant has been one of the top scorers in the ongoing series against England.

Who is Laurent Mekies? Red Bull boss who replaces Christian Horner?Red Bull shocked the Formula 1 world on July 9 by sacking Christian Horner. Horner, who was at the position for nearly two decades was replaced by Laurent Mekies.

Sachin Tendulkar portrait unveiled at Lord's: Artist reveals stunning detailsSachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at Lord's, marking a memorable day for the cricket legend. The artwork was created by Stuart Pearson Wright from a photograph he took at his home 18 years ago.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
